com

Interface Communicator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCommunicator, ClientCommunicator, ServerCommunicator

    public interface Communicator
extends java.lang.Runnable
    Interface for interacting with a Communicator.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(CommunicationListener cl)
      Adds a CommunicationListener to the list of listeners.
      void disableLogging()
      Disables logging for the communicator
      void enableLogging()
      Enables logging for the communicator
      boolean isLoggingEnabled() 
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns if the mainThread is still running or not
      void setState(MopedState state)
      Adds the new state to the queue of data to be sent to another communicator.
      void setValue(MopedDataType type, int value)
      Adds a new value of given type to the queue of data to be sent to another communicator.
      void start()
      Starts a Communicator in a new thread.
      void stop()
      Stops the Communicator from communicating.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Returns if the mainThread is still running or not
        Returns:
        boolean

      • addListener

        void addListener(CommunicationListener cl)
        Adds a CommunicationListener to the list of listeners.
        Parameters:
        cl - CommunicationListener to be added.

      • start

        void start()
        Starts a Communicator in a new thread. Must be called for communicator to start communicating. If the queue contains items, the queue will be cleared. A communicator may only be started/stopped once.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the Communicator from communicating. Use start() to start communicating once again. If data is queued to be sent and stop is called, the queue doesn't get cleared. Queue does get cleared in start() though. A communicator may only be started/stopped once.

      • setState

        void setState(MopedState state)
        Adds the new state to the queue of data to be sent to another communicator. Will call onStateChange(MopedState state) on the CommunicationListeners registered to the other communicator.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to add to the queue.

      • setValue

        void setValue(MopedDataType type,
              int value)
        Adds a new value of given type to the queue of data to be sent to another communicator. Will call onValueChanged(MopedDataType type, int Value) on the CommunicationListeners registered to the other communicator
        Parameters:
        type - The type of data to be added
        value - The value of the data

      • isLoggingEnabled

        boolean isLoggingEnabled()
        Returns:
        True if logging is enabled, false otherwise.

      • enableLogging

        void enableLogging()
        Enables logging for the communicator

      • disableLogging

        void disableLogging()
        Disables logging for the communicator
